title: Healdsburg After Dark Stand-Up Comedy with Steve Ausburne
description:
We said we were a community hub, right? We said we bring Healdsburg to life? Well… it’s time to put our money where our mouth is. And we’re doing it right! We’re kicking off a brand-new series of stand-up comedy nights with one of the best standup comedians in town (in our opinion, in other people’s opinions, and soon, in your opinion too): Steve Ausburne!

Maybe you laughed your face off at our last comedy night in November - or maybe you didn’t… because you weren’t there. Either way, Steve is back. He’s our main man, living-room ringmaster, and the producer behind the show. Steve’s comedy career got its start as an MC for friends’ bands, which eventually led to his first stand-up set - a set so memorable it earned him a lifetime ban from a church in Grants Pass, Oregon. But Steve didn’t let that slow him down. Instead, he embraced the stage as a place for brutally honest, painfully awkward life confessions - the kind usually reserved for therapy, or very, very funny comedy.

And he’s not coming alone.

Jalisa Robinson joins the lineup - a proud Midwesterner now living in California, and a 2022 Semi-Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition. She’s a favorite at The Punchline San Francisco, Cobb’s, San Jose Improv, Rooster T. Feathers, and Don’t Tell Comedy, and performs regularly at clubs and festivals across California and beyond. If sharp, witty, and hilarious is your vibe, Jalisa’s got you covered.

And then there’s Ronn Vigh - our headliner. Ronn has written for *Fashion Police* on E! Television and performs stand-up at clubs, colleges, and venues across the country. He still dreams of becoming a weatherman (we support the dream). In the meantime, he’s an avid yogi (when not hungover), a devoted *Golden Girls* fan, and - despite being gay - a lifelong football lover.

title: John Reischman and the Jaybirds
description: Bluegrass, old time and acoustic roots music with outstanding musicianship Like the powerful mandolinist and composer at its helm, John Reischman and the Jaybirds fashion a stylish take on bluegrass that seamlessly blends original songs and instrumentals with Appalachian old-time music for a truly unique band sound. Now in their 20th year, with seven acclaimed albums and two Juno nominations, the Jaybirds are simultaneously innovative and unadorned, sophisticated and stripped-down, happily old-fashioned and 21st-century contemporary.  Tickets are $35 advance, $40 at the door. Discount for OCA members. Doors open at 6:30 PM. OCA is wheelchair accessible. Art gallery open during intermission, refreshments for sale.  Get Tickets  Bluegrass Unlimited calls John Reischman "one of the world's undisputed masters" of the mandolin, famed for outstanding tone and taste. Many of his dozens of original instrumentals have become popular favourites for sessions and covers, such as the jam standard Saltspring. He has three critically-acclaimed solo instrumental albums and has recorded on many other projects, including the Grammy-winning True Life Blues: The Songs of Bill Monroe. John also plays Latin-based jazz and choro music with highly regarded finger-style acoustic guitarist/composer John Miller; the duo has released three superb albums. John began his career in the San Francisco Bay area in the early '80s with the eclectic Good Ol' Persons bluegrass band. He was an original member of the legendary "new acoustic" quartet, the jazz-influenced Tony Rice Unit, renowned for highly skilled instrumentals. John moved to Vancouver in the early '90s and in 1999 formed the Jaybirds. Of their latest album, Folk Radio UK said "On That Other Green Shore showcases an accomplished, experienced band at the peak of their powers, with musicianship of the very highest order." Peghead Nation called it "one of the most beguiling bluegrass-rooted recordings of 2017." Los Angeles, CA-based guitarist Patrick Sauber joined the Jaybirds in 2017. The veteran performer has played with, among others, Doc Watson, Richard Greene, John Jorgensen, Peter Rowan, Tim O'Brien and John Fogerty. He played on the 2016 Grammy-nominated album The Hazel and Alice Sessions by Laurie Lewis, and appeared in the film A Mighty Wind with Christopher Guest. Bluegrass Unlimited describes Patrick's playing on John's tune Daylighting the Creek as "a glorious flatpicking solo that hews back to the glory days of early bluegrass guitar." Chilliwack, BC-based Trisha Gagnon is portrayed by Sing Out! as "one of the most versatile" and "irresistible" lead vocalists in bluegrass, her strong and distinctive style ranging from "mournful and plaintive" to "hopeful and yearning." Trisha anchors what Dirty Linen magazine calls "gorgeous three-part harmonies." She's also known for songwriting, dating back to her early days with the award-winning B.C. bluegrass band Tumbleweed. Her solo album includes guests Vince Gill and Peter Rowan. Nanaimo, BC-based Nick Hornbuckle has developed his own voice on the five-string banjo - a two-finger roll unlike other contemporary banjo players. "Nick Hornbuckle's banjo can be downright spine-tingling," said the L.A Daily News. His solo album 12×2 \(\+/-1\), was nominated for a Canadian Folk Music Award in 2015, and Nick is a composer who also digs for rare old-time gems. His sprightly instrumental Wellesley Station on the new Jaybird album "showcases Nick's sharp picking and sense of melody," said Green Man Review. Spokane, WA-based Greg Spatz is hailed as a "world-class bluegrass fiddler" by Fiddler Magazine. Audiophile Audition says Greg's "virtuosic playing is flawlessly delivered time after time," while Bluegrass Unlimited says he "lays down some seriously fine bluegrass fiddle" on the latest Jaybirds release. His strong chops have made him a popular fixture down through the years on the West Coast, where he's played with iconic mandolinist Frank Wakefield, resophonic guitar master Rob Ickes, and many others including Laurie Lewis, Bryan Bowers, and Eli West and Cahalen Morrison. Greg also plays and records with Mighty Squirrel, has a solo album called Fiddler's Dream and a duo recording with his wife called All Along the Sea, and is an award-winning

title: The Polly Klaas Community Theater presents: The Jungle Book!
location: Polly Klaas Community Theater,417 Western Avenue, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
PKF & PKCT in association with Missoula Children’s Theater present:


THE JUNGLE BOOK

Adapted by Michael McGill

Music and Lyrics by Michael McGill

Ever been abandoned in the jungle, adopted by wolves, taught by a bear, befriended by a panther and chased by a tiger? In the Missoula Children’s Theatre musical adaptation of THE JUNGLE BOOK, Mowgli the man-cub has all these adventures and more. Join him as he escapes from the Bander-log, outwits a tiger, enlists the help of a rock-python, explores what it means to be human and learns a lesson from the brave mongoose Rikki-Tikki-Tavi. Original music and rollicking humor give new life to the classic tale by Rudyard Kipling.

Three shows are scheduled: 2/27 at 7pm and 2/28 at 2pm and 5:30pm. Get your tickets now to see local kids put on an amazing performance of this classic; all auditioned, rehearsed, produced, and presented in just one week! Tickets are available on our event page HERE >> https://www.pollyklaastheater.org/event/the-jungle-book-by-missoula-childrens-theater-2-27-7pm/

Celebrating over 50 years of touring, the Missoula Children’s Theatre International Tour has fostered developmental life skills in more than a million kids. Our tour reaches 65,000 children in more than 1,000 communities in all 50 states and 15+ countries each year. One of the many ways the Missoula Children’s Theatre remains vibrant is through generous donors all over the world.

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life’s curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate—and an impromptu happy hour—and decide it’s high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they’ve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment—and most importantly, realize it’s never too late to make new old friends.

title: Water Tower
description:
Water Tower is the current moniker of multi-instrumentalist Kenny Feinstein’s musical brainchild, originally founded in 2005 in Portland. While their lineup has evolved over time, fuelled by Feinstein’s masterful song-crafting, fiercely DIY approach, and genre-bending sonic identity, Water Tower have established themselves as a global force to be reckoned with.

Pioneers of a new wave of bluegrass and old-time with a distinctly punk rock flair, Water Tower take influences from Foghorn Stringband and Bill Monroe to Rancid and Black Flag, passing them through a unique lens that magnifies the individual strength of their core and auxiliary members while remaining faithful to the revivalist spirit.

In 2015, the band moved to LA, where their current lineup of Kenny Feinstein \(lead vocals, guitar, fiddle, mandolin\), Tommy Drinkard \(banjo, vocals\), Taylor Estes \(Bass, Vocals, and Nicholas Leahy \(mandolin, vocals\) can often be found busking while not in the studio or on tour.

Since then, Water Tower have built major momentum, releasing a concept album Fly Around \(ft. guest vocals from Black Flag’s Ron Reyes and produced by Don Bolles of The Germs\), filming 1m\+ view viral videos, and catching the eye of A-listers including Katy Perry, whose 2023 NYE party they played at, and Riff Raff, who shouted out “Take Me Back”, the debut single from their upcoming album Live from Los Angeles, to be released later this year. A slew of tour dates in the US and the UK has already been announced.

title: A Good Deal
description:
**A Raven on the Road Production at the Cloverdale Performing Arts Center**

Kate, a psychologist from Santa Fe, unexpectedly shows up at the door of her old flame, Bo, with a life-changing secret she is reluctant to share. As she struggles with opening up to Bo, Kate also seeks to reconnect with her estranged daughter who lives nearby. Brimming with humanity and humor, *A Good Deal* is a bittersweet tale of love, loss, and family connections. Developed through the Raven Players’ ScripTease program.

**February 27th, 28th, March 1st, 6th, 7th, 8th.**

**Friday and Saturday Shows: 7:30 PM Sunday Matinee: 2:00 PM Doors open 30 minutes before showtime.**

**Admission: Adults: $25 Student w/ID: $10**

title: Boeing Boeing
location: Burbank Auditorium Studio Theatre, SRJC Santa Rosa Campus
description: The play is set in the 1960s, and centers on bachelor Bernard, who has a flat in Paris and three airline stewardesses all engaged to him without knowing about each other. Bernard's life gets bumpy, though, when his friend Robert comes to stay, and complications such as weather and a new, speedier Boeing jet disrupt his careful planning. Soon, all three stewardesses are in the city simultaneously and catastrophe looms.

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description: In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

Ready to step up your salsa game? Salsa – partner dancing class build on the basics, introducing exciting new turns, footwork, and partner patterns to elevate your dancing.

Must have intermediate steps in place

Proficiency in lead/follow & turns

Proficiency in timing & partnership

No partner necessary

This class is designed for dancers who have a solid foundation in salsa fundamentals and are ready to take their skills to the social dance floor. Moving beyond basic steps and patterns, we’ll focus on the essential techniques, musicality, and partner-work dynamics that make for confident and enjoyable social dancing. title: Sonoma Guitar Series Sérgio & Odair Assad 60th Anniversary Tour
description: Brazilian-born brothers Sérgio and Odair Assad celebrate 60 years of setting the standard of guitar innovation, ingenuity and expression. Their exceptional artistry and uncanny ensemble-playing come from a family rich in Brazilian musical tradition and studies under guitarist/lutenist Monina Távora, a disciple of Andrés Segovia. Their virtuosity has inspired a wide range of composers to write for them including Astor Piazzolla, Terry Riley, Radamés Gnattali, Marlos Nobre, Nikita Koshkin, Roland Dyens, Jorge Morel, Edino Krieger, and Francisco Mignone. Sérgio has added to their repertoire by composing music for the duo that showcases their virtuosity.

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: The Mask Of Zorro With Live Soundtrack By Members Of Renegade Orchestra
description: The Mark of Zorro is where it all began - the original swashbuckling version of Zorro. Premiering in 1920, this landmark film set the tone for all future adaptations of Zorro and it also influenced action movies in general. During this special showing, members of the Renegade Orchestra will perform a newly composed soundtrack - live! One night only.

title: XO Chips XO, Halou and Identical Homes
location: The Big Easy, 128 American Alley, Petaluma, CA, 94952, United States
description:
Petaluma’s own Xo Chips Xo makes tightly constructed electronic music that leans toward 80s minimal pop—crisp beats, angular bass/synth lines, balancing precision with a dry, playful edge. 
Halou is the long-running project of Ryan and Rebecca Coseboom who quietly built a deeply devoted audience by writing music that feels like an internal conversation. Their sound blends dream-pop, electronic atmospheres, and intimate songwriting that has resonated far beyond expectations.  
Identical Homes is the experimental project of California-based musician and producer Daniel McKenzie, known for his work in bands like The Rum Diary, Built for the Sea, and Shuteye Unison. With Identical Homes, he creates a deeply atmospheric and exploratory sonic world, blending elements of ambient, post-rock, electronic, and art-pop. Live, Daniel is joined by Jake Krohn (Shuteye Unison, The Action Design), Lia Rose (Built for the Sea), and Greg Kelly (Sunset Junior, Fight Like Fight). Together, they trade instruments often, weaving between ambient interludes, tribal rhythms, and dreamy pop choruses.

title: The After (DJ Dev)
description:
Fridays | After Comedy

More people are skipping heavy liquor and messy nights — and honestly, same. This is the new move: Soju cocktails, elevated mocktails, and a club vibe that lets you party without wrecking tomorrow.

title: Live Music – Peter Filice
location: Adobe Road Tasting Room, 6 Petaluma Blvd. N - Suite A1 Petaluma, CA
description: Join us for a special Saturday acoustic live music set at Adobe Road Winery in downtown Petaluma. Sip on award-winning wines while enjoying talented local musicians in a warm and inviting atmosphere. Choose from wines by the glass or bottle to discover new favorites. Reserve your spot on Tock and make it a memorable night of great music, fine wine, and good company! About Peter Filice A lifelong vocalist and guitar player, Peter has been in the Bay Area music scene since the 1990’s. He was vocalist and guitarist for the South Bay band OTR, winners of the KFOX Last Band Standing competition in 2010, and subsequently, in 2015, started a very successful acoustic act, P.S. Acoustic Music, performing in solo, duo, and trio formats at numerous South Bay venues. He also has performed in tribute shows to Creedence Clearwater Revival, Three Dog Night, Linda Ronstadt, and his own Simon and Garfunkel tribute. Having recently relocated to Petaluma, Peter is now performing at many North Bay venues as well as maintaining shows in the South Bay.

title: March Month of Flowers Challenge
description:
**Starting March 1st begins the "March Month of Flowers Challenge" (online).** 

You'll receive a list of prompts for every day in March. 

Create an art piece related to the prompt.

Share in our private Facebook group.

Be inspired and give inspiration to others.

**Only $5**, so everyone can join and share in this creative adventure!

***March Month of Flowers* Challenge** is here to give you a creative outlet, some structure, and respite from your brain. 

When you pick up a brush, pen, or pencil (thread, clay, fabric…), your brain gets a rest and becomes more alive and flexible. The world around you becomes more alive; you pick up on shades, details, and patterns all around you. Your intuition gets stronger. And fear lessens, anxiety fades, and curiosity grows. You stop worrying about making mistakes, and instead, you find the freedom to simply create

title: Sonoma County Restaurant Week
description:
Come out and Restaurant Week 2026 from February 23 - March 1! This is your chance support the vibrant and diverse culinary scene of Sonoma County and taste the unique flavors that our local restaurants have to offer. By dining out during the week, you'll be supporting small businesses and helping to sustain our local economy.

There are no tickets or passes required. Simply dine out at as many participating restaurants as you would like during Sonoma County Restaurant Week. Each restaurant will have at least one prix fixe menu to choose from.

This year, Restaurant Week is celebrating eateries that feature entrées sourced from 100% Sonoma County sourced ingredients and/or pour Sonoma County wines. Dining farm-to-table has never been so easy!

So gather your friends, family, and foodie companions, and make a reservation at one of our participating restaurants today. Your taste buds will thank you, and you’ll be supporting our local community at the same time. Let’s make this Restaurant Week one to remember!

The Mindful Stream (CA)
"Awareness of the inner body takes you beyond the mind." - Eckhart Tolle

In this mediation session we will bring our attention here: to the inner body where we practise presence by focusing on our physical sensations.

Sessions are suitable for newcomers, those experienced in Tolle's teachings and anyone wishing to remain completely anonymous. title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That’s why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps: You’ll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work: Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns: We’ll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We’ve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required: Whether you’ve never danced before or it’s been a while, you’re welcome here!

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: BLS Certification Class (American Heart Association)
description:
BLS Certification Class \(AHA\) - In Person, Instructor-Led

American Heart Association BLS certification class \(in-person, instructor-led class in our Rohnert Park classroom\). BLS \(Basic Life Support\) is the required CPR class for healthcare providers. Includes cardiac and respiratory arrest management, CPR, AED use, and choking treatment for all ages. This class is appropriate for initial BLS or BLS renewal.

Vive CPR is an American Heart Association \(AHA\) Training Site. AHA "BLS Provider" certifications are issued on the same day.

We also offer Blended Learning BLS certification courses \(online course plus in-person Skills Session\).

Learn from a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/bls-certification/

Questions? Call/text \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

title: Caring for Your Olive Trees with Paul Vossen at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:
Join us at Gold Ridge Organic Farms for a half-day workshop dedicated to the successful management of olive trees. Whether you're a home grower with a few backyard trees or an orchard management professional, you'll gain valuable insights from this focused session. Paul will explore essential topics including the definition and physiological causes of alternate bearing, best practices for pruning, irrigation, and nutrition, as well as practical strategies to reduce alternate bearing and improve overall olive production. The class covers both organic and conventional farming methods, giving you a comprehensive toolkit for cultivating healthier, more productive olive trees.

The session will be held in our milling area, with portions taking place in the orchards if weather permits. Please dress in comfortable layers to accommodate changing conditions and wear closed-toe, non-slip footwear suitable for walking on uneven terrain. Coffee and tea will be provided throughout the event.

Paul Vossen is a legendary local Farm Advisor and Emeritus Extension Agent who retired from UC Davis in 2016 after 35 years of distinguished research and teaching. He holds an M.S. in Tree Crops Production and a Certificate in Olive Oil Production from Cordova, Spain, and is passionate about helping farmers and home growers cultivate exceptional fruit. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from a seasoned expert and gain new insights to enhance the health and productivity of your olive trees.

title: Foothill Park with Dogs
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Let's go for a hike with the dogs. Foothill is a beautiful community park. We'll be taking trails that wind through gently rolling oak woodlands, past 4 ponds and up to Alta Vista if it's not too hot. Best for dogs and people who hike regularly.

**Where We Meet/Directions**
Foothill Regional Park
1351 Arata Ln, Windsor, CA 95492
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive, pay park fee and use the toilet. It often takes longer than you think.

**The Hike**
Length - 3.5 miles/5.6 kilometers - A loop hike
Elevation change - 500 feet/152 meters
Difficulty - 5 out of 10 Easy
Exposures - 40 % sun/60% shade - poison oak, ticks/insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 34 oz./1 liter.
Dogs - Yes, well behaved and on a leash.
Facilities at trail head - Bathrooms
Cost - $5 cash
Parking - $8 Parks fee or free on the street.
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring water, for your dog too, a hat, and layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**When We Meet**
Saturday February 28, 2026
**09:30am - 11:30 am**
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP. Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion! Hike may be changed, postponed or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately.**

title: Nature Hike at Lynch Canyon
description:
This hike will take visitors westward along Middle Valley Trail leading to Prairie Ridge. Expect about a 5 mile hike at a moderate, but even pace over uneven ground. Muddy spots will have cattle prints. There are steep climbs over several hills with the longest at Prairie Ridge. It’s worth it to see the view of the northern San Francisco Bay.

Meet in the parking lot: Parking is $5. Please be prepared to pay by cash or check. Envelopes are in the iron ranger near the main gate.

\*Please note, cancellation of the hike may occur due to County Fire Danger Warnings and closures of open spaces and parks. Once registered, you will receive any updates should this ever happen. Hike level: Moderate to Moderately Strenuous

Lynch Canyon is an open space park owned by Solano Land Trust and operated through partnership by Solano County Parks.

These prints can be used later to letterpress a text on to make it a background for a broadside.

description:
Understanding the Nervous Systems of Horses and Humans with Heart and Mind Equine's HSH (highly sensitive horses). Everyone welcome.

**Speaking Horse Class** is offered by Heart & Mind Equine Horse Rescue. This began as our volunteer class and has expanded to serve the larger community. A chance to meet our rescued therapy horses, check out our volunteer program, and learn some holistic horse keeping and equine assisted services (e.g. therapy, coaching, leadership, and teambuilding with horses). NO experience necessary, and both horse and mental health professionals are welcome--truly all are welcome (9+ years old.)

Curious about Equine Assisted Psychotherapy? Speaking Horse is not therapy, but it is an opportunity to get a "taste" of EAP because we use some of the same tools and exercises in both settings. So come out out and meet the herd (both humans and horses) connected with Friendly Trails and Heart & Mind Equine.

Each month the class is centered on a holistic horse keeping theme, equine assisted learning, understanding herd dynamics, holistic horse care and training, or how they all relate to our human journey. FEBRUARY THEME: Year of the Fire Horse As the Lunar New Year is in February, we will borrow the theme of the passing Year of the Snake, shedding what is old and no longer needed and embracing the power and majesty of the horse. This time of year also coincides with the horses literally shedding (plan to be covered in horse hair as we groom them.) We will explore how the herd's ecosystem changes as they experience spring and the lessons we can learn from them.

Horse lovers, highly sensitive people, mental health providers, parents, and teachers might especially benefit from this class as well as horse owners/riders who hope to improve their relationships with their equine partners. (Though this work is great for dogs as well, your dogs are not welcome at our horse rescue due to liability and distraction concerns.) Newcomers and novices are most welcome.

Come and experience the magic of working with horses firsthand. Get ready to roll up your sleeves, get your hands dirty, and connect with these majestic creatures. Whether you're a seasoned equestrian or just starting out, there's something for everyone at our Speaking Horse classes. Don't miss out on this exciting chance to bond with horses and fellow horse lovers. We can't wait to see you there!

title: Overeaters Anonymous (OA) Newcomer Meeting
description:
**Is Food a Problem for You? You Are Not Alone.**

Overeaters Anonymous (OA) is a fellowship of people who support each other in recovering from compulsive eating and food behaviors. If you feel you have a problem with food, OA welcomes you—no matter what your background, beliefs, or eating habits. 

We hold an in-person newcomer meeting on first, second and fourth **Saturdays of the month from 9:45 - 10:15 AM at** ​**Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Marin, 240 Channing Way, San Rafael CA 94903**. Contact: Sue M. 415-298-6792​. You may view all North Bay OA in-person and online meetings at https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

In OA, members experience **spiritual, emotional, and physical recovery** by practicing the **Twelve Steps** and living by their spiritual principles—one day at a time.

OA is **not** a diet club or calorie-counting program.

Members have different plans of eating.

OA does **not** endorse any specific food plan. 

If food is causing problems in your life, you don’t have to struggle alone. Recovery is possible, and help is available.

**Visit:** https://www.northbayoa.org/

**Find a meeting:** https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

title: A Year to Live
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine’s *A Year to Live*, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

**Program Includes**

**Format**: Online via Zoom (must know how to join a specific breakout room manually)

**Teachings**: Monthly (12) large group sessions (attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st)

**Home Groups (required!)**: Monthly (12), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location (online or in-person) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

**Home practice**: Guided meditations, readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

title: Forest Bathing Walk
description:
Come enjoy a gentle, guided Forest Bathing Walk where East meets West at the Sonoma Botanical Garden. This event is inspired by the Japanese practice of shinrin yoku or “forest bathing.” Forest bathing is the intentional practice of slowing down and immersing oneself in the sights, sounds, smells, and sensations of the natural world in order to restore well-being and deepen our relationship with nature.

This walk will be led by Susan Karle, a Certified Forest Therapy Guide, who brings over a decade of experience guiding nature connection practices with people of all ages. Her approach integrates her background in grief and trauma work with a deep respect for the healing power of nature.

Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

title: Naturally Arising Samādhi and Insight
description:
with Phillip Moffitt

The Naturally Arising method starts meditation practice in a different manner. It begins with a preliminary, preparatory practice in which all the attention is systematically and repeatedly oriented inwardly. During this weekend non-residential retreat, Phillip will teach two practices that create the conditions for what he terms an “inward staying mind” to naturally arise.

The first of these practices is “The Three Renunciations,” which establishes a discerning mind that is free of reactivity and self-judgment. The second practice, the Arriving Sequence, establishes a mind state that is available for practice and aligned with the Dhamma. When combined, the fruition of these practices is a naturally arising responsive mind. In this way, we become free of the efforting that so often plagues our practice.

From there, we turn toward the Four Foundations of Mindfulness and we explore different capacities of consciousness that enhance insight. Throughout the meditation practice periods, there is continual emphasis on directly knowing experience through the felt sense. The result is a mind that has great clarity and is available to the natural emergence of wisdom and compassion.

title: Salsa Beginner Marin – Saturday
description:
**Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?** Join on on Saturday – Salsa Beginner Marin

Are you a beginner who’s always wanted to learn salsa? Salsa classes are designed to help you build a strong foundation. In this class, you’ll learn the fundamental footwork, practice the basic turns, and understand the essential body movement that will make you feel confident on the dance floor. This class is perfect for anyone ready to learn the techniques and foundational steps needed to start their salsa journey.

Salsa is fun, and we make learning it stress-free! Our relaxed, beginner-friendly class is the ideal starting point. You don’t need a partner, nor any dance experience!

In this class you will learn:

Basic directional steps that form the foundation of salsa.

Proper frame for comfortable and effective partner-work.

Simple, easy-to-remember turn patterns.

Get ready to learn the fundamentals and have a great time!

**Details:**

**No partner necessary**—rotations ensure everyone dances

Please wear **non-marking shoes** to protect the floor

Arrive 10 minutes early; warm up and settle in

**When:** Saturday, 10:00 am – 11:00 am

**Where:** 4140 Redwood Highway #8, San Rafael, CA

title: Sugarloaf Through the Ages
description:
Join Sugarloaf docent Susan Perkins in a geology hike to learn about more about the geological formations that give Sugarloaf Ridge State Park its namesake, how soil composition influences native flora to thrive, and take a lightning-fast journey (in geological terms) through the history of the area, from the time California was underwater to today's volcanic caldera remains. 

Meet at the White Barn parking lot. Tickets are $10 for general audiences, $5 for youth (12-17 year olds; must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian), students, Sugarloaf Members, Sugarloaf or RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Wear layers, appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water, and if desired, a snack, binoculars, and/or a camera. We invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rains cancel. Parking fees apply.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative
description: New Woman and Fox paintings by Teri Sloat celebrate the personal journeys we take as we travel outward through landscape trails or inward through thoughts and dreams. Her ongoing series, Woman and Fox, A Journey, present rich, metaphorical paintings that invite you to pause on your own path and enjoy the distance you have come.

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  2/13/26

**MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN**

EXHIBIT DATES:  February 23 – March 29, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artist, **Tosya Shore,** presents **Celebrating Women,** paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women’s History Month. Shore’s watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.  These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.  A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in “Good Point.”  The artist takes us into nature with “Redwood Rendezvous” where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.    “Just Back from Vegas” captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.  “There’s such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic – women deserve nothing less,” noted Shore. 

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

 The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Donna Schaffer’s Ooh La La, Plein Air,** a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.  Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with “la belle vie.” The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in “Café le Bistro”, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.  One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer’s unique view of the Eiffel Tower in “Paris is for Lovers.” “Every day was an adventure in Paris – I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there”, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net** 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

title: Aspiring Pilot Seminar
description:
Thinking of a career as a pilot? Not sure what steps to take to get there?

Join us for an exciting event aimed at future pilots. Whether you're just starting to dream about flying or you're already on your way to becoming a pilot, this seminar is for you.

The Aspiring Pilot Seminar is a great first step in understanding how to start your career as a pilot. From learning how to choose the right aviation university to understanding the different stages of flight training, this is your chance to learn all you can, directly from CAU Admissions and staff.

During our seminar, you’ll understand: -how flight training works, -the role of an aviation university in your journey, and -how to ask the right questions when researching and comparing schools. Plus, we’ll cover important topics like: -how financial aid works, -the FAA medical certificate, -the difference between ATP and R-ATP certifications, and -how to choose the best flight plan for you.

Don't miss out on this chance to take your passion for aviation to new heights. Come join us at the Aspiring Pilot Seminar and let your dreams take flight!

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: Jazz & Ballet Combo: Ages 8-12
description:
Saturdays, January 17 – March 14, 2026 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Categories: Dance & Movement, Kids

Ages

8 – 12 years old

$200 Total Registration Fee

Registration Fee includes full enrollment for 9 weeks of instruction and the recital costume fee

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps.

About the Class

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps. Instruction will include warm up exercises, increased vocabulary and beginning mini ballet barre ballet positions, across the floor exercises, beginning turns and leaps and beginning choreography is taught at the end of class to different styles of music. Exercises will be modified or enhanced to the individual’s level. Class will be conducted in a positive and attentive environment and is designed to develop memorization, flexibility, and musicality. This class will help the student gain coordination and confidence to take into their daily lives. Small performing opportunities based upon a child’s interest but is not mandatory. There will be a recital on Saturday, March 21. More details to follow. Benefits include listening skills and concentration, increased coordination, and an understanding of movement, i.e. time, space, directions and balance, social skills and development of creativity.

Required Supply List

Dance shoes, ballet slippers or barefoot \(Need shoes, see below\) Please no socks \(grippy kind ok\) or just tights as the floor can be slippery. Comfortable clothing to move in or dancewear such as leotards, skirts, skirted leotards and tights \(with shoes\) of any color or style. Please no tutus or pajamas in class. Hair pulled off of face. Dress in layers as it can go from chilly to warm fast! Being dressed and ready for class is part of the experience and encourages focus and participation.

Location

Room 213, Dance Studio

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Annual Chili Bowl Fundraiser for the Sonoma Community Center
description:
Never Heard of Chili Bowl?

Every year, the ceramics department artists begin making bowls in October. By the time they are done, they will have made over 800 bowls, at least 300 cups, and countless vases for table decorations. Local chefs donate delectable chili of various kinds, including vegetarian options.

When you attend a Chili Bowl lunch seating, you will first enter a room with a selection of hundreds of handmade bowls. Don't worry, the bowls are divvied up in advance so that every lunch and dinner seating has a similar selection. Pick your bowl and then head to the kitchen to choose your chili with all of the fixins. We'll have cleaning stations and bags for you to take your bowl home.

What goes into Chili Bowl each year?

900\+ unique handmade ceramic bowls

1 metric ton of clay

40 gallons of hand-mixed glaze

50 kiln loads of bowls, vases, and cups

90 gallons of chili made and served

700\+ people dining throughout the day

Saturday, February 28, 2026 Three seating options available: 11:30 AM, 1:30 PM, and 5 PM

Every February, the annual Chili Bowl celebrates community, food, and clay. Featuring artisan bowls made by the Center's ceramics team and a variety of hot, steaming chili prepared by local chefs, the Chili Bowl brings our community together to create a sense of warmth during the rainy tail-end of winter.

What comes with your ticket?

Lunch tickets \($38 per person\) include a beautiful handmade bowl of your choosing with a hearty chili of your choice, as well as toppings, cornbread, and dessert.

Dinner tickets \($75 per person\) include all of the above \+ a handmade cup and cocktail/mocktail, along with some special entertainment and auction items.

description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

location: Polly Klaas Community Theater, 417 Western Avenue, Petaluma, CA, 94952, United States
description:
PKF & PKCT in association with Missoula Children’s Theater present:
THE JUNGLE BOOK
Adapted by Michael McGill 
Music and Lyrics by Michael McGill 
Ever been abandoned in the jungle, adopted by wolves, taught by a bear, befriended by a panther and chased by a tiger? In the Missoula Children’s Theatre musical adaptation of THE JUNGLE BOOK, Mowgli the man-cub has all these adventures and more. Join him as he escapes from the Bander-log, outwits a tiger, enlists the help of a rock-python, explores what it means to be human and learns a lesson from the brave mongoose Rikki-Tikki-Tavi. Original music and rollicking humor give new life to the classic tale by Rudyard Kipling. 
Three shows are scheduled: 2/27 at 7pm and 2/28 at 2pm and 5:30pm. Get your tickets now to see local kids put on an amazing performance of this classic; all auditioned, rehearsed, produced, and presented in just one week! 
Celebrating over 50 years of touring, the Missoula Children’s Theatre International Tour has fostered developmental life skills in more than a million kids. Our tour reaches 65,000 children in more than 1,000 communities in all 50 states and 15+ countries each year. One of the many ways the Missoula Children’s Theatre remains vibrant is through generous donors all over the world.

description:

Choose from wines by the glass or bottle to discover new favorites. Reserve your spot on Tock https://www.exploretock.com/adoberoadwines/ and make it a memorable night of great music, fine wine, and good company!

About Peter Filice

A lifelong vocalist and guitar player, Peter has been in the Bay Area music scene since the 1990’s. He was vocalist and guitarist for the South Bay band OTR, winners of the KFOX Last Band Standing competition in 2010, and subsequently, in 2015, started a very successful acoustic act, P.S. Acoustic Music, performing in solo, duo, and trio formats at numerous South Bay venues. He also has performed in tribute shows to Creedence Clearwater Revival, Three Dog Night, Linda Ronstadt, and his own Simon and Garfunkel tribute. Having recently relocated to Petaluma, Peter is now performing at many North Bay venues as well as maintaining shows in the South Bay.

title: 22nd Annual Kelseyville Father Daughter Dance
description:
For more than twenty years, the Kelseyville Father Daughter Dance has served as a beloved community tradition, bringing families together for an evening dedicated to connection, celebration, and lasting memories.

This years event will be Saturday, February 28th, 2026 from 5:00-9:00 pm at the Kelseyville Presbyterian Church, 5340 3rd St, Kelseyville, CA, US, 95451

Founded with a simple yet meaningful mission, the annual event provides girls with the opportunity to share a special evening with their father or a significant male figure in their lives. Whether attending with a dad, grandfather, uncle, mentor, or family friend, participants experience a night centered on strengthening relationships and creating joyful moments.

The event has grown into one of the community’s most anticipated gatherings, known for delivering a memorable and engaging experience for all guests. Highlights of the evening include professional DJs, treat boxes for attendees, a flower presentation for every girl, raffle prize drawings throughout the night, and a souvenir photos for every guest.

Every dollar raised through the Kelseyville Father Daughter Dance is reinvested directly into funding the event. In select years, proceeds have also supported high school scholarships benefiting girls who have participated in the dance. The event is made possible through the dedication of adult volunteers who generously donate their time and efforts.

“Our goal has always been to create a magical, meaningful experience for families,” organizers shared. “Seeing generations of attendees continue this tradition is what makes the event truly special.”

As the dance continues its long standing legacy, organizers look forward to welcoming both returning families and first time participants to celebrate another year of this treasured Kelseyville event.

title: Opening Reception: Collaborative Works 2026 by Connect the Dots Art Studio
description:
"Collaborative Works 2026" showcases a selection of paintings and textiles by Anna Rochester and Barbara Libby-Steinmann. Inspired by the natural landscapes of Marin and Sonoma Counties, the artists engage in direct collaboration, applying their respective skills simultaneously to each piece. This approach yields both large-scale and smaller works, which are on view at Usher Gallery from February 17th to March 22nd.

Join us for the opening reception on Saturday, February 28th, from 5-8pm to celebrate “Collaborative Works 2026”, enjoy live music by Rojo, meet the artists, and graze on light refreshments and wine.

Anna and Barbara serve as co-directors of Connect the Dots Art Studio (CTD), a recently established arts-based nonprofit in Marin. CTD brings people together to experience art through installations, workshops, and events that invite individuals to tap into and express their creativity. By “connecting the dots,” CTD creates opportunities for the community to engage with art, make art, buy art, and connect with artists and creative individuals. More details about CTD can be found at: connectthedotsartstudio.org/ https://connectthedotsartstudio.org/ https://connectthedotsartstudio.org email: art@connectthedotsartstudio.org mailto:art@connectthedotsartstudio.org

description: Join us for the best crab feed in Vallejo. We'll be serving salad, bread, shrimp, clam chowder and of course CRAB! title: Live Music Saturday Copy
description: Joyce Grant Joyce Grant singer/songwriter, is no stranger to Vallejo. She performs regularly at the Vallejo Ferry Bldg. Taproom, the Coalshed as well as the Benicia Taphouse. A mezzo-soprano with a voice like dark honey, Grant has been singing jazz and R&B in the Bay Area for over 30 years at venues such the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco, the Ledson Hotel in Sonoma, the Empress Theater in Vallejo, Sam's Chowder House in Half Moon Bay, Nick's in Pacifica to name a few. She is the great-great-niece of famed ragtime composer Scott Joplin and is a frequent participant in the West Coast Ragtime festival. For the past 3 years she has been the lead vocalist for the Walnut Creek Jazz Band, an 18- piece big band. As a songwriter she has released the CD In The Morning \(co-produced with Doug McKeehan , 2010\), a collection of original songs ranging in style from jazz to blues to R&B. She continues to bring her sensitive and powerful vocal interpretations to appreciative audiences that keep coming back for more.

title: Northstar Mix Exchange
description: The Northstar Mix Exchange is a vibrant gathering aimed at connecting music enthusiasts and creators. This event features a selection of talented DJs who will showcase their skills and unique styles. Attendees can expect an electrifying atmosphere filled with diverse sounds and engaging Dj set performances. It is a must-attend for anyone looking to explore new musical landscapes and connect with like-minded individuals.

title: The Real Truth About the Black Cowboy
description:
This Black History Month Program Explores the Real Truth About the Black Cowboy

When: February 28, 2026 from 6:00-8:30 PM Where: Vallejo Naval & Historical Museum, located at 734 Marin Street, Vallejo, California Admission: $10, Open to the public

In celebration of Black History Month, Askari Sowonde~ Productions invites the public to a powerful and engaging evening titled "The Real Truth About the Black Cowboy."

This educational and cultural program challenges long-standing myths of the American West by centering the often-erased history of Black cowboys-skilled horsemen, ranchers, trailblazers, and community builders who played a critical role in shaping the nation.

Donald Jordan will emcee & speak as well as featured speaker Albert R. Harris who will lead the conversation, sharing historical insight, lived knowledge, and cultural truth about Black cowboy legacy and its lasting impact on American history.

The evening will also include dynamic entertainment featuring Julie Bland Latin Jazz, Elyon cultural fashions/ Kimberly Pergerson-Williams, young poet and storyteller Nora Sanna, Saxophonist Ric Alexander, Klassicman-Marvin Gaye tribute and more, celebrating Black creativity, artistry, and heritage across generations.

The event is open to the public and is designed for families, students, history enthusiasts, and lifelong learners seeking a meaningful Black History Month experience grounded in education, culture, and community

title: Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo
description:
Verismo Opera presents Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo

Free Admission. Become a member to support our new free admission policy.  Membership will be good for a year from purchase and will entitle members to early seating \(before non-members\) for performances.

 Stage Directors: Kristin Lund and Jennifer Rineman 

Conductors: Jonathan Khuner and Paul Schrage

Chamber Orchestra with English Supertitles 

In association with Mira Theatre Guild

For company information and to purchase memberships visit www.verismoopera.org

Dido and Aeneas is a monumental English Baroque opera masterpiece.  The story is based on Virgil’s The Aeneid and tells the tale of love and tragedy between Dido, Queen of Carthage, and the Trojan hero Aeneas.  This beloved gem includes stunning choruses, duos, trios and the iconic aria "Dido’s Lament".  In contrast to Dido and Aeneas’ measured passions, Pagliacci is full of uncontrollable passion, jealousy, tragedy, murder, and betrayal.  Laugh and weep with Canio as he sings "Vesti la giubba" \(the clown who cries behind his makeup\).

Mira Theatre Guild, 51 Daniels Avenue, Vallejo, CA 94590

- February 22, 2026 \(Sunday 3:00pm\)

- February 28, 2026 \(Saturday 7:00pm\)

title: Ron Burris  / An Intimate Evening of Jazz
description: Ron Burris is a talented saxophonist who is based in Vallejo, California. His early background was in R&B, including performing with Project Soul, a group that later had success as Con-Funk-Shun. After becoming inspired by Gene Ammons, he switched his focus to jazz. A few years ago, Burris released his debut CD, Mr. Cool, soon followed by a second album, Shades Of Jazz, and now presenting his third and latest album, Ron Burris Jazz... Never Felt So Good.

For the first time at THE 222, he is joined by a group of talented vocal artists in a program titled “Intimate Grandeur.” Featuring large-scale works for eight-part choirs, this program will be sung in the intimate confines of THE 222 by an octet, singing one-on-a-part. Works by Giovanni Gabrieli, Sergei Rachmaninov, Charles Ives, and others.

Sponsored by Marjatta & Steven Daniels and an anonymous donor

Choral - Programmed by Sanford Dole

description: STEREOTONGUE is a hard rock quartet based out of the Bay Area California.

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life’s curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate—and an impromptu happy hour—and decide it’s high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they’ve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment—and most importantly, realize it’s never too late to make new old friends.

title: The Social Contractors Rock Penngrove Pub!
description:
“….Get ready for the super-entertaining sounds of local band The Social Contractors. They totally rock, in all the right ways…” – Argus-Courier

The Social Contractor are thrilled to return to The Penngrove Pub with their exciting blend of upbeat original rock and classic hits from the 60s-90s featuring melodic vocals, searing guitar and sax solos, and a dynamic rhythm section that will get you moving on the dance floor!

The line up for the evening includes band founder Jason E. Davies \(vocals/guitar\), Travis Thayer \(sax/keys/vocals\), Rob Neidel \(bass/vocals\), and Chris Oatman on drums.

Join us on Saturday, February, 28th for an evening of great live music, food, beverages, and positive socialization with The Social Contractors!

title: A Good Deal
description:
**A Raven on the Road Production at the Cloverdale Performing Arts Center**

Kate, a psychologist from Santa Fe, unexpectedly shows up at the door of her old flame, Bo, with a life-changing secret she is reluctant to share. As she struggles with opening up to Bo, Kate also seeks to reconnect with her estranged daughter who lives nearby. Brimming with humanity and humor, *A Good Deal* is a bittersweet tale of love, loss, and family connections. Developed through the Raven Players’ ScripTease program.

title: Boeing Boeing
location: Burbank Auditorium Studio Theatre, SRJC Santa Rosa Campus
description: The play is set in the 1960s, and centers on bachelor Bernard, who has a flat in Paris and three airline stewardesses all engaged to him without knowing about each other. Bernard's life gets bumpy, though, when his friend Robert comes to stay, and complications such as weather and a new, speedier Boeing jet disrupt his careful planning. Soon, all three stewardesses are in the city simultaneously and catastrophe looms.

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description: In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: March Month of Flowers Challenge
description:
**Starting March 1st begins the "March Month of Flowers Challenge" (online).** 

You'll receive a list of prompts for every day in March. 

Create an art piece related to the prompt.

Share in our private Facebook group.

Be inspired and give inspiration to others.

**Only $5**, so everyone can join and share in this creative adventure!

***March Month of Flowers* Challenge** is here to give you a creative outlet, some structure, and respite from your brain. 

When you pick up a brush, pen, or pencil (thread, clay, fabric…), your brain gets a rest and becomes more alive and flexible. The world around you becomes more alive; you pick up on shades, details, and patterns all around you. Your intuition gets stronger. And fear lessens, anxiety fades, and curiosity grows. You stop worrying about making mistakes, and instead, you find the freedom to simply create

title: Pawsport Napa Valley 2026
description:
Pawsport Napa Valley 2026

PURCHASE YOUR PAWSPORT HERE: https://napahumane.org/events/pawsport/

What Your Pawsport Unlocks: • One complimentary wine tasting per Pawsport holder at each participating winery • Access to a curated lineup of dog-friendly Napa Valley wineries

How to Use Your Pawsport: • Your Pawsport is valid March 1–April 30, 2026 with one tasting per person, per winery • Be sure to check each winery’s hours and reservation requirements before visiting, as many locations do require reservations

Your Impact: Every Pawsport supports Napa Humane’s Power of Prevention—helping fund lifesaving spay and neuter surgeries and preventive care that reduce overpopulation and prevent suffering. Together, Pawsport supporters help make it possible to fund up to 246 days of lifesaving surgery each year, creating a lasting impact for animal welfare in Napa County.

Ready to Sip for a Cause? Grab your Pawsport, explore Napa Valley wineries, and enjoy complimentary tastings all while helping protect pets through prevention-focused care. Don’t forget to share your adventures using \#PawsportNapaValley and by tagging @napahumane.

Thank you for helping make Napa Valley a more compassionate place for pets and the people who love them—we can’t wait to raise a glass with you this spring! 🐾🍷

Have a question? Contact Gillian Ferro at gferro@napahumane.org or by phone at \(707\) 255-8118 x205.

title: Sonoma County Restaurant Week
description:
Come out and Restaurant Week 2026 from February 23 - March 1! This is your chance support the vibrant and diverse culinary scene of Sonoma County and taste the unique flavors that our local restaurants have to offer. By dining out during the week, you'll be supporting small businesses and helping to sustain our local economy.

There are no tickets or passes required. Simply dine out at as many participating restaurants as you would like during Sonoma County Restaurant Week. Each restaurant will have at least one prix fixe menu to choose from.

This year, Restaurant Week is celebrating eateries that feature entrées sourced from 100% Sonoma County sourced ingredients and/or pour Sonoma County wines. Dining farm-to-table has never been so easy!

So gather your friends, family, and foodie companions, and make a reservation at one of our participating restaurants today. Your taste buds will thank you, and you’ll be supporting our local community at the same time. Let’s make this Restaurant Week one to remember!

title: Marin County - Cars and Coffee
description:
ATTENTION…we are under the watchful eye of the Vintage Oaks Shopping Center! BEHAVE!

1. The first Sunday of every month, rain or shine, in front of Starbuck’s in the Vintage Oaks Shopping Center Novato, California.

2. 6:30 am in the morning to 10:00am. Arrive when you want.

3. Check your ego at the stop sign.

4. Park where you can.

5. It’s free! Excluding your Starbuck’s purchases! Please do patronize the local stores!

6. Leave when you want. BUT, behave yourself! No burnouts, no running over pedestrians, no sudden left turns into center dividers. Seriously, you won’t impress anyone and the other 300\+ cars owners will not take kindly to any attempt you might make to screw up this event.

7. Photographs will be taken of your car.Many of these photographs \(including personalized license plates\) will find their way to the web.

8. The Marin Cars and Coffee Facebook page posts pictures, monthly, that participants may continue to revel in the experience and to allow others, who missed attending, to fill this void in their lives.

9. This is a family friendly get-together.

10. There is a welcomed police presence \(hint, hint\).

11. Enjoy yourself! This is a wonderful assembly of diverse car owning folks! Lots to see and lots to learn!

title: Join us for Guided Buddhist Meditation and time for questions
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
New and experienced meditators are welcome. We will start with direct guidance to begin the practice and allow time to experience the silence of meditation on your own. There will be time at the end for your questions regarding meditation practice.

You may stay on for a potluck meal at 11:00 am. Welcome to bring a dish to share.

This is followed by Sutta Study program from 1:00 to 2:30 pm.

We meet outdoors in the Dhammadharini Monastery Garden in the Sala Pavillion, as long as conducive weather lasts.

Come in person, or register at [here](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2) to attend online

title: Mindfulness Sunday Meditation: Cultivating Consciousness
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
Join us for a transformative workshop on mindfulness meditation and cultivating consciousness. Dive deep into the teachings of Theravada Buddhism, focusing on insight meditation to develop a clear understanding of the nature of the mind and consciousness. This workshop will include guided meditation sessions to help you strengthen your meditation practice and cultivate mindfulness in your daily life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, this workshop offers a welcoming space to explore the depths of your own consciousness and enhance your spiritual journey. Come together with like-minded individuals to deepen your practice and connect with the wisdom of Theravada Buddhism, and provide an opportunity to deepen mindfulness, wisdom, and inner stillness.
Our sessions are led by Bhikkhunis closely associated with our Dhammadharini Sangha. Check out the [recording from the past event](https://youtube.com/live/s07U2kzWoWk?feature=share) on our YouTube channel.
You’re also welcome to join us in person at Dhammadharini Monastery, in the peaceful setting of our outdoor Dana Sala Pavilion
Register for this event on Dhammadharini's website to receive the address:
[https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2)
Check out the sangha website at
[https://www.dhammadharini.net](https://www.dhammadharini.net/)

title: SUNDAY IN SONOMA   5  scenic  miles
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
THE TOWN of SONOMA has a lot of curb appeal - scenic neighorhood's - vineyards - shops, so lets go see them. We will start at the parking lot BEHIND the Barracks ( see the MAP & pics ) walk in & around the PLAZA.- bring water if needed!

title: Pt Reyes Coastal Trail
description:
Mindfull Hikes
***Please be in good enough shape to hike at a moderate/fast steady pace (+/-2.5 mph) and comfortable with elevation changes.***

**Distance:** +/- 6 miles total
**The hike:** An easy mostly flat round trip hike to the coast. We'll add a little extra this time by heading south on the Coastal Trail when we get to Sky Camp for about .8 miles and turn around. +/- 1 mile of the hike will be on the beach. A little sand in your toes is good for the soul. We'll take a leisurely break on the beach.

**Parking:** Large grass parking area on the right after you pass Limatour Lodge (use to be the hostel)

**Where to meet:** Meet in the large grass parking area on the right after you pass Limatour Lodge (use to be the hostel)

*Please be on time. We’ll start promptly at the start time listed.* Give yourself a little extra time to arrive and get situated so that you’re part of the opening circle as this is an essential part of our time together.

Restroom available +/- 1.5 miles in at the coast

**What to bring:** Snack, water, hat, good hiking shoes, a joyful spirit and laughter. Please dress appropriately for the weather that day. Layers of clothing are always advisable.
**===================================**
**Reminders:**
Mindful hikes are intended to be a way to connect more fully with ourselves, each other and with the land. There will be two periods of silent walking throughout the hike to allow the senses to be fully alive and felt. There will also be time during the hike to visit and connect with each other. These times of talking and connecting are an invitation to bring mindfulness to the present moment. **It's a time to put away the cell phone and cameras to disengage from technology to be fully present with each other, our *senses and the land we are inhabiting.***

***If you're on the waitlist for the hike and want to attend please message Vickie a few days before the scheduled hike. Most hikes have people drop off at the last minute and it's possible there is an opening.***

**Dāna**
In the spirit of the Buddhist tradition mindful hikes are offered as a dāna based event. Rick Hansen says “generosity is a beautiful practice that opens and gladdens the heart, relaxes the contraction of ‘self’ and ripples out into the world to touch many people.” The dāna practice is **heart centered** and in the spirit of generosity. Venmo or cash is graciously accepted. Venmo account is: @vickieix8; last four digits 4714 of my phone # if asked.

**No-Show Policy:** Please cancel at least 24 hours before the start of the hike. Be mindful that there may be a waitlist. If your plans change and you're not coming, opening up a spot 4-5 days before the hike it's more likely someone will be able to attend than if you cancel at the last minute. You're considered a no-show if you cancel at the last minute. Members with 2 no-shows are removed from the group.

title: Marin Arts & Crafts Show
description:
Join us **February 27–March 1** at the **Marin Spring Arts & Crafts Show** and explore over 200 artisan exhibits in a vibrant handcraft marketplace. Inspired by the Arts & Crafts movement, the show celebrates handcraft in all its forms — a wonderful way to welcome the spring season while discovering beautifully made, one-of-a-kind work and supporting today’s makers.

Discover a wide variety of handcrafted goods, including woodwork, textiles, ceramics, jewelry, furniture, artisan foods, and more — all created by the artisans themselves.

#MarinArtsAndCrafts #MarinEvents #SpringInMarin #Handcrafted #ShopHandmade #SupportArtisans #BayAreaEvents
